transcript:
Agent: Thank you for calling billing support. How can I help you today?

Customer: Hi, I just got my bill and it's $50 more than usual. I don't understand why.

Agent: I'd be happy to look into that for you. Can I have your account number?

Customer: Sure, it's 78392.

Agent: Thank you. I'm looking at your account now. I can see the increase is due to overages on your data plan. You used 15GB over your 10GB limit last month.

Customer: Oh no, really? I didn't realize I went over. Is there any way to get that waived? I just started a new job and was using my phone more for work.

Agent: I understand. Let me see what I can do. Since this is your first overage in over two years, I can apply a one-time courtesy credit of $25 to your account. For future months, I'd recommend upgrading to our 20GB plan which would actually save you money if you continue this usage pattern.

Customer: That would be great! Can we switch to that plan now?

Agent: Absolutely. I've upgraded your plan to 20GB starting next billing cycle, and I've applied the $25 credit to your current bill.

Customer: Thank you so much for your help!

Agent: You're very welcome. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

Customer: No, that's everything. Thanks again!
golden_summary: Customer called about unexpected $50 billing increase. Agent identified cause as 15GB data overage charges (exceeded 10GB plan limit). Customer requested waiver due to new job requiring more data usage. Agent applied one-time $25 courtesy credit (first overage in 2+ years) and upgraded customer to 20GB plan starting next billing cycle to prevent future overages.

key_points: Bill increased $50 due to data overages
Upgraded to 20GB plan to prevent future issues
